intro: Anagallis quartiniana var. meyeri-johannis, commonly known as the Meyer-Johannis sandstar, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a low-growing perennial that produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white. The plant has a succulent, fleshy stem and leaves that are typically covered in a fine, white pubescence. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or as a container plant. Its unique appearance and compact growth habit make it a popular choice among succulent enthusiasts.
